name: flagrancy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a bad action, situation, person, etc.) the state or quality of being shocking because of being so obvious: It is the flagrancy with which these lies are told that I find so hard to bear. The judge remarked on the flagrancy of the defendant's crimes and his lack of remorse.
More examplesFewer examplesThe flagrancy of the police misconduct that this video highlights will shock everyone.The flagrancy with which these people abuse others on social media shows that self-policing isn't working.
